definition: to recover/to recuperate
surname Xiu
to rest/to stop doing sth for a period of time/to cease/(imperative) don't
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
breath/news/interest (on an investment or loan)/to cease/to stop/to rest/Taiwan pr. [xi2]

sentences.english: Now, years of doing this (a.k.a “deleveraging”) have restored purchasing power. Debts have been reduced or eliminated;
sentences.chinese: 如今，數年的“休養生息”重新塑造了強大的購買力。

sentences.english: 8A wolf pack is bedded down in the snow in Yellowstone national park.
sentences.chinese: 一羣狼正在以黃石國家公園的雪地爲牀，休養生息。

sentences.english: We will make continued innovation on the way to rehabilitate overloaded rivers and lakes.
sentences.chinese: 繼續創新讓不堪重負的江河湖海休養生息的有效途徑。

sentences.english: Now, years of doing this (a.k.a “deleveraging”) have restored purchasing power.
sentences.chinese: 如今，數年的“休養生息”重新塑造了強大的購買力。

sentences.english: It aims to rehabilitate and develop natural forests.
sentences.chinese: 主要解決天然林的休養生息和恢復發展問題。

sentences.english: Period and relax, adjust the mood.
sentences.chinese: 期間休養生息，調整心情。

sentences.english: External pressure for its slow created rehabilitate's golden days.
sentences.chinese: 外部壓力的減緩爲其創造了休養生息的黃金時期。

sentences.english: Fishing is now banned for two months of the year to allow marine life a chance to breed.
sentences.chinese: 每年禁漁兩月，以給予海洋生物休養生息的機會。

sentences.english: After years of war and chaos the people urgently needed rehabilitation.
sentences.chinese: 人民於連年戰亂之後，已亟待休養生息。

sentences.english: By the "Spirit Kangxi and Qianlong" period of recuperation, rapid population growth.
sentences.chinese: 經“康乾盛世”時期的休養生息，人口迅速增長。

definition: fears of trouble in the rear (idiom); family worries (obstructing freedom of action)/worries about the future consequences/often in negative expressions, meaning "no worries about anything"
comfortable niche
army provisions/rations and fodder
to capitulate
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
lit. to return to office after living as a hermit on Mount Dongshan (idiom); fig. to make a comeback
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
to counter every move/to be full of tricks
bring order out of chaos/set to rights things which have been thrown into disorder
to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
fair competition
disproof/rebuttal/reductio ad absurdum
cause/triggering factor/incentive/inducement
to prevail upon/to coax
